definition: to write to an organization or a company, usually in order to ask them to send you something
to cancel a debt; to recognize that something is a failure, has no value, etc.
to damage something, especially a vehicle, so badly that it cannot be repaired or would cost more to repair than to replace
to decide that somebody/something is a failure or not worth paying any attention to
a fungus used in making beer and wine, or to make bread rise
a baby or very young child
a child at school between the ages of four and seven
the time of life when a person is young, especially the time before a child becomes an adult
the quality or state of being young
young people considered as a group
a young man
a chemical element. Zinc is a blue-white metal that is mixed with copper to produce brass and is often used to cover other metals to prevent them from rusting.
(in some places in Africa) a sheet of corrugated iron that is used to make a roof, shelter, etc.
the practice of allowing areas of land to be used only for a particular purpose
the act of dividing an area of land into smaller areas
the scientific study of animals and their behaviour
a disease that can be spread from animals to humans
the process or work of keeping financial accounts
the parts of a building that are made of stone
the work of building with stone
a job or profession
the way in which you spend your time, especially when you are not working
the act of moving into a country, town, etc. and taking control of it using military force; the period of time during which a country, town, etc. is controlled in this way
the act of living in or using a building, room, piece of land, etc.
the height above sea level
a place that is high above sea level
a small bay (= an area of sea that is partly surrounded by land)
a man
a deep valley with steep sides of rock
connected with the control of your feelings, especially your desire to have sex
able to control the bladder and bowels
a narrow area of water where the sea flows into the land
a small river or stream
in a difficult or bad situation
the responsibility for something wrong that has happened or been done
a bad or weak aspect of somebody’s character
something that is wrong or not perfect; something that is wrong with a machine or system that stops it from working correctly
a mistake made when serving
a place where there is a break that is longer than usual in the layers of rock in the earth’s crust
to look for and discover mistakes in somebody/something; to complain about somebody/something
used to say that somebody has a lot, or even too much, of a particular good quality
a high area of rock with a very steep side, often at the edge of the sea or ocean
to decrease quickly and suddenly in quantity or quality
a supply of something that is available to be used in the future or when it is needed
a piece of land that is a protected area for animals, plants, etc.
an area of land in the US that is kept separate for native North Americans to live in
the quality that somebody has when they do not talk easily to other people about their ideas, feelings, etc.
a feeling that you do not want to accept or agree to something, etc. until you are quite sure that it is all right to do so
an extra player who plays in a team when one of the other players is injured or not available to play
a team that is below the level of the main team
an extra military force, etc. that is not part of a country’s regular forces, but is available to be used when needed
the lowest price that somebody will accept for something, especially something that is sold at an auction
available to be used in the future or when needed
arrangement in a straight line
a situation in which something is in the correct relationship with something else
political, business or other support given to one country or group by another
financial support from a sponsor
the act of supporting a person, organization or activity, especially financially
the act of introducing a proposal for a new law
relating to sheep
the fact of having a place to live or stay, considered as a basic human need
protection from rain, danger, or attack
a structure built to give protection, especially from the weather or from attack
a building, usually owned by a charity, that provides a place to stay for people without a home, or protection for people or animals who have been badly treated
the state of continuing to live or exist, often despite difficulty or danger
something that has continued to exist from an earlier time
the principle that only the people or things that are best adapted to their environment will continue to exist
a large tree with spreading branches that produces smooth brown nuts inside cases that are covered with spikes. There are several types of chestnut tree.
a smooth brown nut of a chestnut tree, some types of which can be eaten
a deep red-brown colour
a horse of a red-brown colour
an old joke or story that has been told so many times that it is no longer funny or interesting
a garden where many different types of tree are grown, for people to look at or for scientific study
the activity of cutting off some of the branches from a tree, bush, etc. so that it will grow better and stronger
the act of making something smaller by removing parts; the act of cutting out parts of something
the study of teaching methods
